Paintings by Bulgarian artists greeted us at the entrance, but also accompanied us up the road to the room, which embraces warm coziness and measured luxury. In addition to the refined taste with which everything is harmoniously combined and the exclusive collection of paintings that make you feel like a fairytale character, the hotel and the room play light jazz music that one could turn off by pressing a key similar to those , which turn on the lights. Cleanliness and hygiene are impressive. Breakfast - one of the pleasures for the senses and especially for those who appreciate food and pay attention to detail and taste. The attitude of the people who welcomed us there was warm and last but not least you can see how responsibly and friendly they are to their guests. Thank you for everything, Gallery 37! It was unforgettable for us to stay with you and we would definitely visit you again! The hotel is a beautiful pearl that can easily be found on the back of the Academy of Music and Dance and stays in the heart forever!.
everything was in perfect condition.
Disliked: the breakfast is a bit different then normal Bulgarian breakfast..

Liked: It‚Äôs a super cozy boutique hotel. The service was exceptional. The staff was extremely polite and attended to our needs, made recommendations and bookings for local restaurants. Rooms were cleaned every say and it was neat and tidy. .Location is amazing. In the heart of the old town and super close to attractions, Kapana and the city center..

Amazing ambiance, location is top-just a couple of minutes from the city center, Kapana and the vivid Plovdiv life, and in tje same time is a very very quiet venue. Breakfast is fun and very good-try the chef‚Äôs one. Staff is awesome and very helpful ( and they wear masks all the time):). Hotel resembles a bit the Hotel D‚ÄôOro in Bologna- the church next door/window is such a treat for the eyes. Management greets the guests at check out and is very keen on any feedback. I will visit again ( when it‚Äôs not that cold and windy)..

Liked: All is perfect.

I have visited many places both in Bulgaria and throughout Europe. This is one of the best ones I have seen so far. Very high end facilities. Rooms are beautiful to look at, comfortable and with artistic style. Breakfast is a 5 start restaurant level. Service is exceptional end to end. Location is within the old city itself, the best place to be if you want to experience Plovdiv..
Disliked: It is difficult to find anything to complain. The only issue I had was finding the parking, but once I checked the hotel page, is was explained very well. Or you can always call..

Liked: Magnificent hotel - everything was perfect. Great location, excellent service, nice and clean. Piece of Art..
Lovely boutique hotel in the old town - very comfortable with interesting original Bulgarian art decorating the walls..

Just a beautiful calm oasis in the middle of the Old Town. We really enjoyed our stay, we were able to park for free about 50m from the hotel. It was a very hot day and it was wonderful to walk into the hotel and not only did it look beautiful but it smelt amazing too. The room decor was fabulous and let us feel we were staying somewhere special and not in a generic room. Place was spotless, shower was strong, bed was firm and toiletries were good. Hotel staff were so helpful, got us a reservation at a restaurant and a map to help us orientate ourselves and just making sure we were ok for everything. So close to the Old theater we could hear the artists singing so clearly if sitting in the outdoor area. Breakfast was wonderful and different as we went with the chef's choice. And was lovely to eat in the outdoor area. The entrance is so pretty, tourists walking by were taking photos of it. Very close to Nebet Tepe for sunrise/sunset viewpoint (7 mins) and to many of Plovdivs attractions. Highly recommended..
Location. In the heart of old town of Plovdiv. Cozy and modern in renovated old house. Recomended.

Very beautiful hotel right in the city center of Plovdiv..- Hotel rooms are all what you need. Very beautifully decorated with all the luxury and amenities you might want.- Friendliness of staff is beyond expectation. All very friendly, accommodating, helpful,....- Location of the hotel is superb. Right in the old city center, close to everything. .- Parking is a big plus. You just have to give your license plate and they give you a pass so you can enter the old town and park close by the hotel..
Disliked: - Not really a 'disappointment', but I think we just expected a little more from the breakfast after reading all the superb reviews of the 'special breakfast'. It is very tasty, but I feel like they could upgrade a little notch. Breakfast consisted out of 6 toasts (all with different tastes) and they were very good, but I think it could use a little more variety then serving only the toasts..

Liked: Wonderfull Hotel with an incredible staff, everything is done in a perfect way to ensure the best service and experience through Plovdiv...Definitly a must do ! Hotel very cosy and clean, rooms are an high end quality, breakfast were served and performed with the best attention and care..
You‚Äôll be hard pressed to have a more comfortable stay in Plovdiv‚Äôs gorgeous old town. Also sports a stunning art collection of Bulgarian masters. The service was exceptional..
Disliked: We had a lovely stay..

Liked: Clean, nice modern independently run it property. Very good breakfast. Conformably beda. Details are important..
Disliked: Too crowed. Was a bit noisy late in de night. Maybe better tables outside for the breakfast..

Liked: The people who work are AWESOME! We came at hotel at 4 pm, and they allow to sit on the terassa, and get some vine together!.

Liked: The style is really nice and modern. The bed is very comfortable. The breakfast is interesting and delicious. Location is great as it is in the old town which is a restricted area..

Liked: Staff were super friendly and helpful, the location is situated perfectly in the Old Town and in general the rooms are very clean and comfortable, also very new build so quite modern.

Well located, right in the centre of  old Plovdiv, with truly remarkable atmosphere and staff that will make you feel at home. Thank you..

Exceptional new hotel in the Old Town, next to all of the main landmarks, such as the Roman theatre, old houses turned into museums, etc.; very stylish, with many lovely paintings of famous artists; staff is professional, kind and helpful; breakfast is great!.

Liked: Perfect location:),staff more than friendly and polite.Speaking honnestly the best hotel in town..Highly recommended if you are one of those who appreciate the high quality of every single detail and want to explore the real atmosphere of the old town..Ivana.

The design and the location..

It was wonderful. Good value the money!.
Everything.

Liked: Amazing rooms right in the heart of the old town..Very luxury interior and friendly stuff..Definitely recommending this place if you look for a exklusiv night at the top location..

Very nice facility, with an extraordinary location. I was in Plovdiv for work but it is certainly better suited for tourism. Very kind staff, I found myself very well and I recommend it. the rooms are very well decorated, shower with great water power, many details, full breakfast, service of 10, cleaning 10 attention from the director and receptionist 10. better impossible. we will always be back

Just perfect!
The location, decor, bed and staff are fantastic. Everything is new and really worthwhile. The breakfast with bruschetta was never better!!

Liked: Exceptional service! Staff were friendly and professional. We were offered a deluxe room without extra fee and we loved our room and the hotel. The service has exceeded our expectations and we will definitely be back!

Very nice and polite manager. Service is also ok. Help with luggage. Room clean, pleasant and first class, although small, as is the bathroom. Air conditioning works quietly and efficiently. Smell and pleasant throughout the hotel. It's worth staying here. The very center of the old town of Plowdiv. Parking 100 meters from the hotel but convenient right next to the amphitheater.
Disliked: A bit strange breakfasts. Two sets to choose from. No Swedish table. Although the sandwiches are good and tasty, but you have to ask for everything because there is nothing on the tables. No tv programs. The hotel is five stars but no pool, spa, restaurant.

Beautiful charming boutique hotel in the heart of the beautiful old town of Plovdiv. A real art gallery, decorated with a collection of original paintings of very great Bulgarian masters. .In addition, Alexander's service at the front desk is impeccable,

A very stylish hotel with unusual paintings in the originals, unusual design, around the hotel, within walking distance, city attractions, walking streets and restaurants. Liked: Very friendly staff. The safety measures were followed at the Code.We had a rich and varied breakfast. The hotel's location is strategically very good. Liked: We stayed for two days for a concert at the antique theatre, which is literally metres from the hotel. Very clean, comfortable and well-appointed hotel. Staff are friendly and helpful. If you travel to Plovdiv, then only Gallery 37 !!! An excellent author's boutique hotel in the historical part of the city. All historical sites and the promenade are within easy reach. The atmosphere is extremely pleasant and the location is more than excellent. It is metres from the Ancient Theatre and minutes from the Kapana and the city centre. The staff, the guys at the front desk, and everyone else were so nice. .We've been to a lot of expensive hotels, and unfortunately, they've always had a limp and they haven't lived up to our expectations, but there was nothing in Gallery 37 that would disappoint us. Hotel: Holiday Inn Plovdiv, an IHG Hotel
Liked: Breakfast was typical of any 4-star hotel. The room was clean and cozy. It is decorated in a contemporary style and all is colourfully combined. The towels in the bathroom were fluffy and they smelled nice. The sheets were clean. There are two types of pillows (harder and soft). The hotel is located in the street, but no noise from the street or other guests.  The hotel has 2 lifts and does not have a long wait or overload. The car park is small, but at least it's in front of the hotel.
Disliked: There was an armchair in the room, and there were two of us. We wanted to watch TV and talk. One key was used for two types of light in the bathroom. It would be nice to have the soft lighting for the night separated by an extra key. Similarly, the curtains‚Äô lights can also be separated from the main room lighting.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Plovdiv, an IHG Hotel
Liked: The hotel is conveniently located for us and sometimes we use it for business purposes. Everything is on a level, except for the inadequate behavior of the staff at times.
Disliked: You can see that there are organisational problems to solve. In the last case, we've got some colleagues from the country. We used 5 double rooms, one for one night, the other for two. Apparently, having two bookings was a problem for the staff because the receptionist has been unable to find a one-night stay for a long time and I had to send it to my colleagues. Even if a confirmed reservation with the relevant number was available, the receptionist continued to claim that "there is no such reservation". After another half hour of wondering, the reservation is still respected and the colleagues are staying. I had indicated in my reservations that I wanted an invoice, and I applied the company's details, even though the hotel had them from previous nights. When we left the hotel, the invoices were not ready, no one would issue them... we asked them to send them by email. Each room has its own invoice ‚Äì a strange solution that creates a gap. And there were gaps, of course.  One invoice was missing, so they had to send it in extra. Slight omissions, one might say, but you shouldn't have them in a hotel with a claim. It was also strange for me to charge a separate parking bill in front of the hotel, which actually belongs to the same company that the hotel is. Logically, a hotel with parking is available free of charge to guests, but the policy here is different.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Plovdiv, an IHG Hotel
Liked: The breakfast was great, the room was very clean and spacious, the staff were very nice, recommended.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Plovdiv, an IHG Hotel
Liked: I'm happy with the service, the cleanliness of the hotel and the restaurant menu. Staff are friendly. The hotel's location is not very close to the centre, and can be reached in about 15 to 20 minutes on foot. I didn't expect it to be so quiet, even though it's at a crossroads, but the outside noise is not heard. Breakfast is a little expensive, but it's delicious and it's worth it. If I had another trip to Plovdiv, I'd definitely go back to this hotel.
Disliked: That I was only for one night

Hotel: Holiday Inn Plovdiv, an IHG Hotel
Liked: The location is good and the hotel itself is new, so you can get the cleanliness and service you would normally expect in Japan. Many of our staff speak English, so even if you don't speak Bulgarian, there is no problem with communication.
Disliked: As a hotel where you can enjoy a bath abroad, this hotel has been used many times. When I booked a king room before, I was assigned a room without a bath, and at that time I was advised that if it was a double or twin room, it would be a room with a bath, so after that I booked a double or twin room. rice field. (Still, just in case, I request a room with a bath as a special request every time.) However, this time, at the time of check-in, all the rooms with a bath are reserved. I was surprised to hear that if you upgrade to a king room, you can assign a room with a bath. If it is impossible to allocate a room with a bath, if you answer that you can not respond to the request, I complained that I searched for another hotel during the free cancellation period, but this time there is no additional charge He assigned me a king room with a bath, but I was disappointed because I had a good impression of my past stay. It's up to you to say that it's a bath at most, but if you live abroad for a long time, you're looking forward to the occasional bath.

The hotel is located at the entrance of the pedestrian zone, close to the main attractions of the city. Great place and great staff. Breakfast was delicious. The hotel is located in the very centre and within walking distance from the main street and the Old Town. There is an option to leave your luggage for storage on the check-out day, which is an additional plus.

We were eventually served breakfast at 10 am that was absolutelly mediocre and had nothing to do with the pictures posted here and on TripAdvisor (e.g. what was supposed to be homemade bread was plain sliced white bread, eggs were absolutelly tasteless, avocado was old, no herbs and spices whatsoever were used.) Hotel: Hotel Imperial Plovdiv, a member of Radisson Individuals
Liked: I stay at the hotel not for the first time. Spacious rooms, a small but good spa center, where they do just great(!) massages. Disliked: There was a lack of a balcony - a problem for smokers (they, in my opinion, they don‚Äôt exist in the hotel building at all), well, and some kind of microwave to warm up or cook food at least minimally at a time when visiting a restaurant is undesirable ...

Hotel: Hotel Imperial Plovdiv, a member of Radisson Individuals
Liked: The hotel staff is superb! Extremely kind, friendly, cooperative, yet professionally doing it. When I arrived, I was given an outside room with outside walls. T.K. I can't stand the cold weather and I keep my room warm quickly, so I asked the employees to get a room that meets my requirements and be medium, between two other rooms. Within three minutes, my reservation was changed, and I got the room type I like. Thank you for the cooperation of the duty team on my day! .It was a great pleasure to have a hotel employee bring me a small set that would improve my mood..In general, the room and bathroom were clean. The bed is wide, comfortable, with lots of pillows. Tea and coffee set is available, as well as guest amenities. The WiFi was good. Guest parking is free and convenient.
Disliked: A few things bothered me, which is why I reduced the hotel's overall score:.- in a Code pandemic situation, I didn't see disinfectant dispensers on the floor or in the lobby. If I missed, please be excused..- after a hard day's work, I decided to relax in front of a TV, but there was an 8-9 TV channel with poor quality. Unfortunately for me, I saw that the menu function was blocked to search for other programs. I hope the menu will be varied from TV and radio channels..- there were no slippers in the wardrobe - there was no shaving kit (razor and foam) and a set of teeth (brush and paste) that were important to us when staying after a busy day - there was no iron, only an ironing board, and I hope, on my next visit, that the above-mentioned good-faith notes were taken into account.

Hotel: Hotel Imperial Plovdiv, a member of Radisson Individuals

Hotel: Hotel Imperial Plovdiv, a member of Radisson Individuals
Liked: The staff is friendly, all questions were answered / resolved quickly (iron, printing documents, calling a taxi). The breakfast is good, buffet style, hot several types of eggs, sausages, vegetables. Tea (in bags), coffee machine, juices. Fresh vegetables, cheeses, cold cuts (sausages). Several types of bread, toaster. Pastries (croissants, muffins), honey (including combs), jams, nuts, etc. Fruit. The room (Double Deluxe) is very large and spacious, a compliment from the hotel upon arrival - cakes, a large bottle of water (not updated). Towels were changed regularly in the bathroom: shower gel, shampoo/conditioner, body lotion, soap, cotton pads/sticks, shower caps.
Disliked: Weak soundproofing with neighboring rooms, you can hear the speech of medium volume. The plumbing in the bathroom needs updating: cracks in the sealant, minimal railing in the bathroom, no curtain when using the shower, water on the floor. Plumbing was installed carelessly, the bathtub was leaking. The location is a little further from the Central Square and the Old Town than we expected (incorrectly calculated the distance on the map). You will have to walk to the Old Town, a 20-minute walk. A little longer to the Central Square. There are not many restaurants / cafes nearby where you can have lunch / dinner, two or three, this is a sleeping area of the city. But a good restaurant at the hotel.

Hotel: Hotel Imperial Plovdiv, a member of Radisson Individuals

Disliked: Lack of pool.

Hotel: Hotel Imperial Plovdiv, a member of Radisson Individuals

Hotel: Hotel Imperial Plovdiv, a member of Radisson Individuals
Liked: Good, comfortable hotel. Excellent breakfast. We stayed for one night, so we did not have time to "try on" all the services of the hotel (Spa, bar ...), but I have no doubt that everything is on top. The restaurant is excellent, the prices are normal, tasty and satisfying, there is a summer terrace. The parking lot is large and you can easily park your car. One minus for us - far from the old city. 30 minutes on foot, in good weather - even normal, only the road is uninteresting. But by taxi no problem for 5 lev. Thanks! We were very satisfied.
Disliked: We could not order a room for 3 through the system (we were with a child). For some reason, you can order only for 2 persons or choose 2 rooms, which is illogical for one family. Perhaps this is a feature of Booking.com. There were no problems at the hotel.

large room with lovely artwork through property. excellent breakfast.

Disliked: The room was quiet small and a bit of an odd shape, limited parking on rough ground next to the hotel.It's just off a main road so some traffic noise.

Liked: Excellent location! Fabulous breakfast. Friendly staff..

The breakfast was good. Excellent value for money!.
The location was pretty good. Only takes about 5 minutes to walk to main street. Our room was really big with 2 couches and 3 beds. Everything seemed nice and clean..
Disliked: Breakfast was just OK. I've had much better and occasionally worse..

Liked: The hotel is in a quiet area with a park directly opposite.  There are some food options and a 24-hour convenience store nearby.  .My room was large with good desk space and a big wardrobe.  The bathroom was updated and clean.  Heat and A/C worked fine, and the windows opened.  My room had no blackout curtains, but there were interior shutters that closed and kept out most of the light..The staff is welcoming.  Breakfast was good, with unlimited coffee and tea.  Overall, I thought the hotel was worth the price, but it's probably at the upper limit for most budget travelers..
Disliked: I could pretty clearly hear sounds from adjoining rooms.  Wi-fi was hit-or-miss, but that may have been a room location issue rather than a general problem.  I thought the walk to the center was a bit far..

Liked: Lovely bathroom;huge, comfortable bed. Free parking. Breakfast was good..
Disliked: The room was a little tired and dated. On a very noisy road, although this wasn't too bad once the windows were closed, but we would have preferred to leave them open to get some air..

Liked: Everything as always!.
Love this hotel, Staff are helpful and friendly. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Excellent location..

Modern, clean, comfortable hotel. Room big and well furnished. Big and well equipped bathroom. All you need plus a bit more. Tasty and big breakfast. Basically what I would expect for that price offered. Center in walking distance..

Clean, comfortable and well located. We had a lovely double room for 3 nights, its really close to the centre and old town. Staff was very friendly. Room is spacious and comfy. Bathroom clean..

Liked: This is a great hotel, walking distance from the old town with a great restaurant opposite. Parking facilities were a bonus while the area was quiet and the room was perfectly fine. The breakfast was great, especially the lemon, honey and ginger drink provided every morning. Excellent..

Liked: You get what you pay for...this hotel is ok and will most likely meet the needs of a lot of people on a budget. However, sound proofing of rooms is non existent and you can hear people from the room/appartment above rather loudly. As a result, I moved from the booked appartment to a bedroom instead but the noise from the traffic was very loud...did not get a good night's sleep. However, its location is perfect as it's near the centre of Plovdiv with so much to do and see. Maybe I am ultra sensitive, maybe not. Maybe I was just unlucky on the night I was there..
Disliked: No sound proofing so you hear people in other appartments and/or rooms, I did and had to move thanks to the kindness of the manager on duty - he was very helpful. The breakfast selection was quite limited, some of the pastry items seemed rather dry, and the cramped arrangement on two small adjacent tables meant having to queue for everything even when it wasn't busy. The location was perhaps a bit further from the city centre than I would have ideally liked..

The neatest Metro station from the hotel to the City Center involves about a 1 mile walk including an uphill walkway off the street involving about 30 steps, not conducive for carrying luggage.  At night, the walk along this steep, unlighted walkway would not seem safe. We did not attempt to test it for this review..

The rest of the service buisness in Bulgaria should take some advice from the working receptionists at this hotel!.
Disliked: The first room we checked into weren't clean. When we lifted up the toilet seat...it was stained with so much disgusting BLOOD!!!. We immidietly got out of the room and saw the cleaning lady, she had JUST cleaned the rooms so I tried talking to her, she didnt speak any english so she called the same receptionist. We showed the receptionist the blood and the room and she appoligized and started to speak with the cleaning lady in bulgarian and showed her the blood stains in the toilet..

Hotel: THE STAY Boutique Hotel Central Square
Liked: Recently renovated property in the very heart of town. The location couldn't be better: everything is just a short walk away. Rooms are very big and well-appointed (free Netflix included) and surprisingly quiet for the location. Friendly staff, countless restaurants and bars literally a stone throw away, this property is ideal for a short or longer term stay..
Disliked: The minibars could be stocked a little better, although there is a 24/7 kiosk right across the hotel selling everything from beer and liquor to sweets and sodas..

Hotel: THE STAY Boutique Hotel Central Square
Liked: The Stay Hotel offers you just the perfect location, posh design, best mattresses, super find bed linen, Smart 43‚Äù TV with complimentary Netflix! The staff is fantastic-young , friendly and super helpful! Thank you for my stay in The Stay Hotel!.

Hotel: THE STAY Boutique Hotel Central Square
Liked: This might be the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in!  That's a bold statement, and I've stayed in many, many hotels throughout the world, but there's something different here. Trouble is, I can't put my finger on it.  A hotel, to me, is just a place to sleep and shower, nothing more. I leave in the mornings and come back in the evening, that's it!  In The Stay Hotel, however, I spent a couple of hours each evening just relaxing in the room. That is extraordinary for me.  The room was bright, and its layout was really pleasing and attractive. Staff are super friendly and try to help whatever request or question you may have.  Its clinicaly clean throughout and kept that way every day. Location couldn't be better, right in the heart of the new pedestrian area and just a short walk from the  old town..
Disliked: Can't really think of much. There's roadworks just down the road, but that's not something the hotel has control over..

Hotel: THE STAY Boutique Hotel Central Square
Liked: I really like the room and the location is just perfect for walks to the Old town. My stay was very pleasant..

Hotel: THE STAY Boutique Hotel Central Square
Liked: A perfect and peaceful stay at a wonderful boutique hotel at the center of Plovdiv. I really enjoyed the smart Tv with free Netflix in the room as well as the snacks. The staff was extremely welcoming. I would definitely come back..

Hotel: THE STAY Boutique Hotel Central Square
Liked: It was a pleasure to be in The Stay Hotel Plovdiv. The location is great, the rooms are comfortable. I like the bed very much. The staff was very kind..

Hotel: THE STAY Boutique Hotel Central Square
Liked: Last year I stayed in hotel "Start" at the same location, and it was so-so and "okay for just one night", but now in the completely renovated "Stay" hotel the experience was different, and awesome! The rooms are now twice larger,  the bed is ... soooo gooood ... I just wanted to take it home with me. :) The TV set, which used to be a forgotten artefact of the mid 1990s, is now an enormous plasma, and the bathroom is very well designed. .Since I'm overly sensitive to light in the night, curtains in hotel rooms are one thing that traditionally disappoints me. Here I was especially happy with the heavy, thick curtains, which completely covered the windows length and didn't let any lightbeam leak through..
Disliked: All four pillows were the same height, and too high for my neck. :) Given the double number, they could have been different sizes and heights, for different necks and tastes..

Hotel: THE STAY Boutique Hotel Central Square
Liked: The central location is just perfect.Totally innovative vision of a small boutique hotel with great attitude and professional service. I will come back for sure the next time I visit Plovdiv!!!.

Hotel: THE STAY Boutique Hotel Central Square
Liked: The bed-mattress was very comfortable..The furniture was very stylish..
Disliked: - stink from the drain in the bathroom.- the door of the bathroom was not openning unless violated. The first time I got lock in there and could not come out, so my partner had to call the receptionist who was also not able to open the door so one of the maid also had to come. At the end 4 people were trying to open the door and by pure luck we've managed. If I was all by myself there, I would have stayed in there forever. The door had no standard handle but a ball-knob handle from inside?! By such an accident already by check-in, I would have expected to be offered another room but we were not. So, every time visiting the bathroom we were afraid not to be able to open the door. At the same time, because of the stink from the drain in the bathroom we had to keep the door closed..- smallest bathroom I have ever been, the toilet seat is too high positioned, no toothpaste.- there is no breakfast amenities inside the hotel.- no toilet in the foaye.- smallest room ever - 16sqm but together with the bathroom!! When the room is with a double bed - the second person has to climb over basically one-person room made as a double room :( It seems they have divided one room into two..- BTV and novaTV (2 of the 3 famoust national channels) were not available - reception said "those channels are not paid"!!.

Hotel: THE STAY Boutique Hotel Central Square
Liked: We were staying 2 people ..We liked the quality of the mattress ..We liked the option of a big TV..We liked that the air conditioner was open when we arrived because the weather was very hot ..We liked the receptionist .We liked the part that we wanted a parking space and the hotel arranged the worker in the parking to wait for us because we arrived very late ..We liked the location of the hotel in general ..
Disliked: We didn‚Äôt like that in order for us to close the curtains in the room we had to step on the bed to reach them ..We didn‚Äôt like the fact that the room was way smaller than any of the pictures we were presented in order to make the booking ..We didn‚Äôt like the fact that if you were gonna have a shower the water was everywhere because of the tiny bathroom ..Also the half glass was removed so the water was literally all over the floor which made it extremely uncomfortable for us to use the restroom if one of us wanted to bath earlier ..We believe the word uncomfortable doesn‚Äôt have to incluse in a hotels vocabulary ..The room was 209..

Hotel: THE STAY Boutique Hotel Central Square
Liked: The best thing about this hotel is the location! It's really central! It's also clean and quiet. The housekeeping lady was lovely..
Disliked: But it's expensive for what it is.. We paid around 100 lv for one night, that's without breakfast and the room and the bathroom were tiny! You couldn't even put your suitcase on the floor, there were no space. I booked it mainly because it's written that it has parking but it turned out that you need to pay extra for the parking and to reserve a spot in advance. Also when I asked for late check out they told me that it would cost 50 lv extra (I understand the late check out depends on the availability and that there might be a cost but not 50% more). The hotel is very basic and it just lacks atmosphere. It's not cozy at all and I just wanted to leave. It just felt like they did a very cheap renovation with modern furniture but they want to make money from everything. For example there wasn't any complimentary water in the room. .Just for comparison, we spent a night in hotel Rila Borovets where we paid 160 lv for a massive room with a great bathroom and lovely view, breakfast buffet, free parking and really late check out (4 pm) + amazing service. We should've stayed there another night instead of going to The Stay in Plovdiv..

Hotel: THE STAY Boutique Hotel Central Square
Liked: The location of Stay Hotel is excellent, in the middle of the main shopping/pedestrian boulevard and close to the historic old town sites. There are many excellent dining options in the immediate area. We also found convenient (paid, 18 lv per day) street parking, which can be difficult so other visitors shouldn't count on it..
Disliked: The rooms are small and feel cramped. But our main problem was the smell in the bathrooms that comes up from the drains. We had 4 rooms and at least two had this problem, which is common in old Bulgarian buildings. Although the bathrooms have a fan, it seems to just suck the smell up from the drains. The bathroom doors close tightly, are hard to open and ours squeaked loudly (metal on metal). To try to solve the smell problem we propped the bathroom door open with an umbrella but it didn't help much. Too bad. Otherwise the hotel is not bad..

Hotel: THE STAY Boutique Hotel Central Square
Liked: The location of the hotel is great, and it is impossible to find a more central location in Plovdiv than this hotel. This naturally may cause parking problems, as the hotel is only in a pedestrian zone, so you can park your car in the private car park (34lv/day) approximately 300 m away and make your stay very comfortable. Located right below the property, Happy Grill & Bar offers a dining alternative to every taste, a very spacious option for our stay in a deluxe room, a baby bed and a clean sleeping kit prepared for our baby, but very quiet rooms, although on the street. The bed was one of the most comfortable hotels in the area for comfort. The front office staff were extremely helpful, and they kept our luggage up until 3:00 P.M. when we checked out. If we come to Plovdiv again, we'll definitely stay.
Disliked: It was our choice, because they said so themselves, that breakfast is not served at the hotel, we have decided that the best option is ATLAS, which is about 50 metres away, which means you can't have breakfast without leaving the hotel. I think you might be able to improve on the whole amenity kit, the disposable slippers we're gonna use in the room and the bath towel that we're gonna use after the shower would make us very happy.

Hotel: Old Plovdiv House in Kapana Area
Liked: Amazing little find smack bang in the centre of the Kapana area. Lots of bars, restaurants (with amazing food) and local street art. 15 mins away from old Plovdiv too! .The hotel itself has a sauna and steam room and small gym if that floats your boat. The apartment we stayed in was a suite which had a bedroom separate to the living area. It was cleaned every day (unless you requested otherwise), and had fresh towels daily. The reception staff were amazing and so helpful. Always greeted is with a smile when leaving and returning to the hotel. All this for ¬£300 for a full week! .It also had a restaurant where you could dine but didn‚Äôt take advantage of that. So many lovely places to eat out (and the food in Plovdiv is stunning!! Even the salads are a must try!). The hotel will also do room service for brekky. Nothing was too much trouble and for an excellent price!!! Can‚Äôt recommend highly enough and if we return we‚Äôll be staying here!!!!!.
Disliked: I‚Äôm picking fault here but the bathroom is a wet room so sometimes traipsed water into the living area and there was no lift (we were top floor). But this wasn‚Äôt a bother overall and didn‚Äôt spoil the experience..

2 minutes walk from the roman theatre and the trendy neighborhood with bars and restaurants (go to "Tams House" for the closest Michelin star experience we found (at not Michelin prices)). Paid parking in front (10 euros a day). The room is very large, many light levels can be adjusted with several buttons, warm led lights. Walls are made of "mud and straw" and all the wood is burned for conservation so there was 0 chemicals used for paint or varnish, which is impressive! Very stylish. There is also a good soundbar to play some music over Bluetooth. The TV has no HDMI cable (it has a satellite card I think), so bring one if you need..The best was the shower cabin with Turkish bath incorporated, a huge unexpected plus. Total SPA feeling after strolling through the city center for hours. The dry sauna had it's own cabin with views over the city. To turn on the Turkish sauna (we thought it was broken initially) from what I remember: press the "light" logo, the "ventilation" logo and long press start/stop (timer should be on eg. 60). Inside the shower press the blue button after 5-10 minutes heating the system!.
Disliked: The small stairs is something compensated by all the plusses. All roof windows have incorporated rollup curtains but the shower was all glass so in the morning lots of light came through. The second night we put some towels over the shower window and covered the tiny bedroom window with the big decorative pillow, that allowed for a few extra hours of rest after sunrise. A curtain covering the whole shower room would be great!.

The location of the house is unbeatable, as it is at the very beginning of the old town, next to the mosque, and 2 min from the modern Kapana neighborhood. Despite its central location in the house no street noise comes through. Our host Ivelina who handed us the keys was very friendly and made us feel welcome from the moment we walked through the door. I would definitely recommend Saborna Guest House and if I go back to Plovdiv I would book there again.

Huge spa, definitely a must and all included in the price.
We had the sky view penthouse for ¬£44 a night with breakfast! Say no more.
Disliked: Mini bar wasn‚Äôt restocked when room cleaned. Was told by reception that made had gone home and store room locked. No big deal really..

Liked: Large appartment, nice breakfast, great gym and spa (3 minutes walking from the hotel). .Very good place..

Liked: Very spacious modern  rooms. Very polite and friendly personal..

Literally everything else was perfect. Beautiful room with a nice view. Cosy atmosphere. Airconditioning. An entire room as a wardrobe. Modern and classy bathroom with a wonderful shower. Comfy bed. Stereo installation. Very good wifi connection just for the room..
Disliked: The toilet paper was not replenished and the toilet itself was splashing water out when flushing (easy to prevent that by closing the lid)..The blinds were not working that well, so I woke up with the sun..

Liked: Central, clean,.

Liked: The roof top room was outstanding and the views was out of this world The staff was outstanding too very helpfull and explaine everthing close to city centre would reckonmend 9/10. Thanks.

The place  is close to the park with fountains, walking distance to the center. Free parking at the place and free access to a very good fitness with SPA. Apartments are big, the bed and sofa were really comfortable. The breakfast is OK (not exceptional, but enough) and all you need. The man (Ivaylo) and girl (Gergana) on reception were very nice and helpful. I'd come again..
Disliked: I only missed a soap bar and dishwashing liquid in the kitchen place. Our apartment (was an atellier) did not have a terrace..

Liked: First impressions were great. Easy check in. Very modern decor. We had a 2 bedroom apartment..
Disliked: The apartment is starting to show wear and tear. The living room floor was cracked. Towel rails missing in the bathroom. Mattresses are very thin and uncomfortable. The door to the balcony in one bedroom is warped and so does not keep sound out. Train and road traffic go all night long. No dish soap or laundry detergent provided though there is a dishwasher and clothes washing machine..

Liked: room.fitnes.spa.
Disliked: reception service.breakfast.

Liked: Overall very nice experience. We stayed for 3 nights and almost everything was perfect. The apartment is really spacious, with huge living room with a kitchen part. The place also had two balconies, two toilets and a big walk-in closet. The breakfast was nice, the furniture is new and stylish, the bed is really comfortable. Also there is a free parking spot which is really nice if you travel with your own car. The hotel is at walking distance from the railway station and is situated in the city center, close to everything we needed. And just a quick advice - if you need a hair dryer and an iron, you can have them from reception free of charge. However there isn't an ironing board in the room or at least we couldn't find it..
Disliked: The staff is really not okay. The guard in front of the hotel was honestly rude when we arrived and asked for the parking and the girl at reception that greeted us and had to explain us where to park our car really couldn't do even that.  Maybe they lack experience but for 4-star hotel and the price that you pay, you really expect better service. There were also one or two things in the apartment that could use some repair work - for example the kitchen faucet - it was honestly broken and there was only hot water. Also a few of the mirrors on the closet doors were cracked and the paint on the bathroom door is starting to peel off but it is not a big deal..

Liked: SPA.
There is a free parking, the breakfast was nice, the flat was spacious. The hotel was 15 minutes from the center..
Disliked: Everything was okay..

Liked: Everything was perfect, i could even extend my stay without any problem.
Wonderful apartment. Well furnished and clean. Staff were very friendly and accommodating!.
Disliked: Nothing! It was a wonderful stay..

Liked: The comfort and location.
Disliked: Missing Breakfast because of early flight in sofia.

Liked: Modern style and lovely designed, spacious and comfortable apartment, The hotel is only 5 minutes walk to the long distance bus station "Avtogara Yug" / 10 minutes walk to the train station / 15 minutes walk to the city center pedestrian street. Friendly staff..
Disliked: The choice of breakfast items is rather limited, The orange juice is actually an average quality orange flavored drink..

Liked: Appartment was on the 9th floor and was very impressive. Massive TV, great kitchen, balconies and excellent toilets, bathrooms and bedrooms. Breakfast was included in the price and was good value for money..Within walking distance of the old quarter but you need a good 15 minutes to get there so only book this location if you're happy to walk..Ample car parking space and a great gym opposite.
Disliked: A little further out than expected and next to a main road and the railway line but not a big issue..Main issue I had was that the third bedroom (that I stayed in) had no TV or more improtantly air conditioning (unlike the other bedrooms and living area) as it was so hot I spent two nights on the sofa with the air con on.way or shut due to road works..Be wary as well as sat navs don't seem very accurate when it comes to Bulgarian streets. Quite often we thought we were virtually there only to find our road was one.

Liked: The space.. Clean... A big apartament of 60sqm with only 60 Euro /night, including a kitchen with a big fridge.Easy walking acces to  city center....5 minutes walk to Billa market( cheap cooked food) .A lot of things to vist for 3 days. Amazing transformation of city center after 45 years of comunism..Restaurant Happy-simply the best.
Disliked: The vecinity of the railway... Too much noise on our side.. Ask for a quiet apartament.Poor breakfast: every day some comunist "salami", some omlette and white/yellow cheese..

Liked: The only thing that was a let down with this property. Breakfast absolutely horrendous. AVOID at all cost. Were better off not providing Breakfast if it is going to be this poor. Put a downer on an otherwise good trip..

Liked: The apartment itself was very nice - clean, modern, lots of space, comfortable. Location of the property is very good - walking distance to the city center (ca. 10mins), as well as to bars, restaurants and night clubs and yet not in the immediate center. There is a free convenient parking lot, property of the building. You also have access to a big and fancy fitness & spa center across the parking lot (different building with no indoor access), which we did not use, but still looked very nice as well. The security guard on duty was extremely polite and helpful. Breakfast was a good quality buffet with limited choice, but still enough. (However this might change, as the previous time we were there breakfast was a choice between a few "breakfast sets", which was not good).
Disliked: - Mattress in our apartment was very soft. .- Windows are not installed/maintained properly and do not isolate the noise from the large road right next to the hotel. .- You have to pay for your stay up front, as they have had guests leave the hotel without paying (at least this was the explanation we were given) and now guests are treated as potential non-payers as well, even though they have your credit card and ID/passport on record. .- The staff (receptionist and the manager of the hotel, who is also "marketing director of several hotels", as she insisted on pointing out) are completely clueless about managing a 4 star hotel, as this property is advertised. They are not bothered too much with communication with customers, nor customer satisfaction. We did not really feel welcome there (but if you avoid most of the staff and don't mind the above points you are very likely to enjoy your stay due to the nice apartments)..

Liked: i liked everything.
Disliked: THE BREAKFAST.

Liked: Nice, clean, cost-effective, modern hotel with very helpful staff and a nice enough pool (pay per use). Each room has a split air conditioner that works whenever you need it..There was one shared iron and an ironing board available for the floor, which was useful..There is adequate parking for guests and one electric charging point for cars. There also happens to be an unaffiliated tasty BBQ place next door..
Disliked: The hotel is let down by a lack of noise insulation between rooms. They also host noisy events around the pool (I presume this is more common on Saturdays in the summer)..The pool is not free for guests (10 Lev; 15 at the weekend)..The rooms have a space-saving theme with three single beds that take up most of the floor space. Only stay here with close family and friends because the toilet/shower is basically a glass box in the corner that does the bare minimum to maintain your privacy..One quirk in the rooms is that they have motion sensors that activate concealed lights, so everyone in the room is alerted when you need to get up in the middle of the night (you could turn this off using the 5A fuse)..There is a no smoking policy for the rooms, but the two rooms I was put in smelled of smoke, which is a bit disconcerting as the hotel reserves the right to heavily fine you if they find evidence of smoking..Why two rooms? The hotel asked us to move on our last full day because there was a "technical problem with the room" (after some questions, we learned that water was apparently leaking into the room below): fair enough, but there was no concession offered for our inconvenience..
.Disliked ¬†¬∑¬†The water in the shower didnt drain properly..

This is the second time we've been to Villa Antika and we'll visit again if we're in Plovdiv. Breakfast is amazing. The staff is very friendly, the location is perfect. Rooms are spacious, clean and well-appointed.
Disliked: This time we were on the second floor and walking into the room above us was a lot of noise. I guess it's because it's a renovated old house.

Liked: Breakfast was delicious, rich and beautifully served!The staff was very polite and friendly! It was quiet and peaceful!We'd love to come back and visit you again! Thanks for everything!
Disliked: I have no objections!

Liked: Location
Disliked: The mattress was deformed, a mattress was put on for comfort, but it wasn't enough to remove the mattress's distortion.

Liked: Everything - location, room, breakfast and staff. Everything was great.
Disliked: The bump is parking. Paid parking lots around here were full. Option is the blue zone in the city, which has turned out to be an unlimited parking time.

Liked: Location, breakfast, spacious rooms and everything.
Disliked: We didn't get any negative impressions.

Liked: Excellent location.

Before we booked, I read the reviews for the friendly staff, alas, I was still pleasantly surprised at how warm we had the reception! Thank you, ladies, for your wonderful treatment and commitment to the customers. We'll be back!
The location is very good right in the center. Breakfast is good and good enough.The staff was caring and friendly. Early check-in is available.
Disliked: Please note that there is a limit to coffee or tea at breakfast.

Liked: We were fascinated by the staff - extremely kind, kind and attentive. He's been cooperating on everything..Our room was great, everything was clean and tidy. Breakfast is good too..The location is close to everything!
Disliked: The only downside is the lack of parking. Perhaps it is wise to consider providing one in the immediate vicinity, which is free for visitors. Get about ¬£20 for a day's parking on the Trimontium.

Liked: Excellent location, 100 metres from the main street, yet in a quiet street, bright and spacious rooms, friendly staff, and a rich breakfast.The restaurant across the street is excellent.

Disliked: No parking

Liked: The decoration
Disliked: That breakfast is already given on a plate with several things that you do not choose. They did not put juice or water and toast without toast. I would have preferred to choose what to have breakfast. Still very good...That the room is on a third floor without an elevator.

Liked: Location, breakfast, room quality, excellent staff.
Disliked: The sound of wood is conveyed between floors... under the ceilings, covered in stone wool.

Liked: Small and very cozy hotel. Very nice antique interior. Near a chic restaurant and coffee shop.
Disliked: Indicated that we will be with two children (9 and 5 years old) but there was only one baby bed and we had to huddle.

Liked: The location is beautiful. The staff has been extremely friendly and truly concerned about our stay!
Disliked: No parking

Liked: Beautiful apartment, special furniture, kitchenette, excellent shower, central and quiet location. Reception staff very friendly, two girls who are always ready to help at the reception.
Disliked: Accommodation includes a very poor breakfast at the nearby cafe. If it is possible to discount by reservation, then do not include breakfast.

Liked: It's a great place with a very friendly staff. Congratulations, man.

Incredibly helpful and friendly staff. The top location combined with a peaceful night's rest and very good room conditions. A pleasant setting with very comfortable beds and a sense of return to the romance of the first half of the last century.
A peaceful place to relax, next to Plovdiv's main street. The Old Town is also metres away, as are the best restaurants in the city. You can hardly see the friendly and helpful staff!
Disliked: The terrace needs repairs, otherwise you feel like you're about to collapse.

Liked: An excellent mini-hotel: a designer fresh renovation, a huge cool bed, a kitchen (we did not use it, but it is). The location is super - next to the pedestrian zone of Plovdiv, 15 minutes to the Old Town. Breakfast in a cafe in a neighboring house, excellent Italian coffee, orange juice, croissants, and, well, little things - sausage cheese, jam, toast. For 89 levs we got a two-room suite, everything was perfectly clean, it was nice to be there. The staff is polite, speaks good English. I'm sorry we only spent one day there.
Superb apartment in the heart of Plovdiv.
Nice setting. Excellent location.
Disliked: Lack of adequate parking space

Liked: A great boutique retro hotel in the heart of Plovdiv! Excellent in terms of cleanliness and service. The location is excellent and minutes from wonderful restaurants, sights. 15 seconds on foot from the main street. Espresso in the morning is excellent! Breakfast was served precisely on time.
Disliked: As a native Plow Man, I declare: For those travelling by car, Plovdiv is a nightmare for parking or paid parking. Keep that in mind! Remember that even if you wish to reach the hotel you can walk as it is in a pedestrian area.

Liked: Exceptional apartment. Clean, refined and very quiet despite the proximity from the course. Breakfast at the Fellini bar next door is also excellent. Fresh fruit as welcome greeting. If I returned to Plovidv, I would have no doubt, I would rebook from Villa Antica. For us, without a doubt, vote 10.
Disliked: Nothing!

Liked: Great location, very friendly staff, great breakfast (in the cafe next door), clean

Very smiling and friendly staff. The girl accompanied us to the room and wanted to make sure everything was fine for us.  A hearty and plentiful breakfast in the caf√© next door. Great location - we had the small balcony with a wonderful view of the ancient Odeon
Fantastic breakfast!.Extra comfortable bed!.Great, really..Especially for families with children it is recommended as the apartments consist of 2 rooms     and kitchen.
Large well decorated studios. Very well located in the center but quiet..PDJ fabulous next door
Disliked: Difficult parking in Plovdiv and the nearest paid parking was closed for work.Well inquire about the rules of stationing

Liked: the superb breakfast!

Hotel full of charm, in the heart of Plovdiv and full of details, from its amenities to the decoration of the room. The treatment of your staff was also excellent, very facilitating to our enquiries. Breakfast in the neighboring bakery is awesome!

The staff was extremely friendly!! We traveled with 2 small children and they helped us with everything. A marvel! The breakfast was very complete and rich. And the apartment very clean and comfortable. A 10.
The location was good and it was good to go because there was a restaurant and a fountain plaza in front of the hotel. Very friendly and the breakfast was good.
Disliked: The door handle to the 3rd floor room was broken.

Liked: Location, amenities, friendliness of staff, top-notch breakfast, quality bedding, fruit basket in the room, calm...
Disliked: Small hics a bit typical for Bulgaria: bathroom door that closes hardly, accumulated apparent proudly above the door... but it's still our best experience in Plovdiv and will definitely be staying again for a next trip!

Liked: Everything. Perfect location, friendliness of staff, exceptional breakfast.
Disliked: Parking is a bit far away and expensive for the country.

Liked: Very friendly and helpful staff. Awesome breakfast! Really good gluten-free bread was available for celiacs and even gluten-free pancakes were baked! Gluten-free options (including vegan cakes) were already available with a basic breakfast. Rooms are spacious, stylish and tastefully decorated! Really quiet and pleasant! Really good location, right next to the promenade. The old town is also very close by. There are good restaurants nearby.

The staff was very efficient in providing support for all our needs, with kindness and courtesy. Despite being a three-star hotel, they brought our luggage up: The hotel in a vintage building has no elevator, even if the stairs are not a problem. .Breakfast at the Fellini bar was more than abundant, varied and tasty. Also the staff there is very kind and nice young people.
Disliked: nothing to complain about. The stay was really pleasant

Liked: Although located on a side street of one of the main pedestrian streets of Plovdiv, the hotel is very quiet and peaceful. Excellent buffet breakfast at the bar next door, air conditioning in the room, comfortable mattress and clean room.
Disliked: Although in the room there was a large kitchen, there were no pots, tea towels and in general the necessary for cooking. We only found a few glasses, three plates and some cutlery. Too bad!
It is not possible to drive to the hotel as it is located in a pedestrian area.

Liked: Top location, great breakfast, friendly attitude, stylish decor. We'll be back.
Disliked: There's nothing we don't like. Everything was perfect.

Liked: Room perfectly clean, large and bright. The location of the hotel is excellent., next to the busiest street, close to the old town. The breakfast buffet is beautiful, varied, with several Bulgarian specialties.  And, better than all, the staff, very smiling, dedicated to make you feel comfortable. In short we just spent three very successful days in Plovdiv.
The staff were extremely accommodating, the breakfast plentiful and the location was great. The value for money very cheap - you can't wish for more.
Disliked: A small drawback was that it was a double bed and no separate beds were available. But for 2 nights it was tolerable because everything else has overcome this small disadvantage by far.

Liked: We were greeted extremely warmly, both at reception and at breakfast in the Dolce Fellini cafe next door. The staff speaks good English, so that the communication is not a problem. The hotel is located in the south of the city center in the pedestrian area; all destinations in the spectacular city can be easily reached on foot. Our room was very spacious and had a kitchenette with a fridge. The beds were comfortable; despite the ground floor location, the room was very quiet. Great value for money!
Disliked: Nothing, everything was great!

Liked: Clean-up was good, and the location was good.
Disliked: Breakfast is fine, but it's for all European countries, so I'm not expecting much.

Liked: Facilities and generosity of the apartment. Cozy modern furnishings. Sensational breakfast!! Location: you cannot do better.

Located on the pedestrian zone, in a side street, beautifully located in the old town. A beautiful spacious triple apartment, overlooking Roman excavations. And the best breakfast in Bulgaria in the coffee shop next door (including).
Disliked: We first tried to get to Villa Antica by car, but we can no longer do that by one way. You should drive straight to the Ramada hotel (34 life a day), and then walk to Villa Antica (5 minutes).

Liked: We liked everything. I would not know what to emphasize because everything was unbeatable. The location in the center, two steps from the old city and next to restaurants, bars and the shopping area. You can walk to all the sites of interest. As soon as you step outside the door of this small hotel full of charm you already realize that it is a special place and you feel fine. The girls at the reception can't be nicer and they go out of their way to help you. The rooms are studios equipped with a kitchen and a very spacious and tastefully furnished room in an early century building fully restored but without losing the charm of past periods. Breakfast is served in Fellini cafe next to the hotel and is the best breakfast we have had during our entire stay in Bulgaria, very varied, all products of exceptional quality and all presented in an exquisite way in an atmosphere that invites you to spend hours, not wanting the time to leave. And above all, we would highlight the kindness and attention of the girls in charge of breakfast. We had breakfast for two days and the second day the waitress greeted us cone if we had been  customers for years and she already knew what kind of coffee we wanted each of the four people we made the group. In short, if you are looking for a special place to feel pampered and unique, Villa Antica is your place. Congratulations to the management and employees of Villa Antica for doing so well.
Disliked: Nothing Everything was perfect.

Liked: Beautiful facility. The room is actually a mini apartment with stove, kitchenette, bedroom and bathroom. All of a great standard, with neat finishes and very clean. Breakfast buffet of excellent quality, with the possibility to choose between sweet and savory. The staff is very courteous.
Disliked: nil

Liked: Location
Disliked: There was a description of a restaurant, but the property said it was closed.

Liked: Location, facilities, cleanliness, staff relations
Great location. WiFI great. Hygiene is good. Nicely furnished and with style. Everything is functional. New furniture. Nice garden in the yard. Very calm and quiet.
Disliked: Breakfast is very meager and exactly the same every day. The quality of the food is also very debatable. There is no insulation between the rooms. You have the impression that someone from the upper floor will fall on your head. Every step is heard in the room above you. Parking is not possible, because it is a pedestrian zone, but there is a secured parking lot nearby, which is not very cheap (34 BGN per day). Maybe another price could be negotiated for the guests.

Liked: Everything. Location, size of the apartment, cleanliness, kindness of the staff, breakfast.

Liked: Before I state the good and positive feedback, I need to mention a few negatives. Breakfast was awfully bad. Especially on the last day of my visit: there was no buffet, so they offered breakfast from the menu. What was served was poorly prepared. The salami for example was like rubber. I took one bite and had spit it out because it was unchewable. .Also, the hotel lacks a solid maintenance schedule. So, the interior lost its glamour (looks old and unmaintained). The same applies to the furniture in the room: the sofa in the larger room (I had booked the apartment on the 11th floor) for example should have been replaced with something new and fresh years ago. But beyond all the rubbishes, there is one highlight not to ignore - something that makes this hotel unique and my favourite choice hotel in Plovdiv: the bathroom that comes with a jacuzzi. I bought some candlelight's in the shopping mall right across the street, and some bath foam and salt....and after filling the tub all the negatives were forgotten..

Liked: Location! 10 minutes to autogarage South. 5 minutes to the hill with the monument to the Liberator. 7-10 minutes to the central park and central streets. Opposite a huge shopping center, with a supermarket. But not around the clock. We were helped out in shopping for little things: water, snacks on the road. Receptionist around the clock. Windows with good sound insulation. We got a room with a great view. Air conditioning worked and succumbed to individual settings. The room had extra clean pillows and blankets. Few outlets. The lighting is dim. The staff were friendly and willing to help. There is also a girl with knowledge of the Russian language, I think it is very nice and useful! Although we could communicate in Bulgarian)) Not everything that the booking shows in the reservation is in the room. But on a call, they provide everything promptly, thank you! At first they did not put a towel for the feet, they put it on the next cleaning. But we didn't ask, we had enough other towels. cleaning every day. We had two nights (the linen was not changed). Breakfast is good continental. I put coffee down. As are juices. Everything else is ok! There were few guests, maybe in other periods something different. We just had enough! What ended, the staff endured. Sliced sausages / carbonates, cheese, cheese, tomatoes, cucumbers. Melted cheese, butter. Lots of pastries. Pancakes. Nectarines, apples, melon. Various flakes, milk and sour milk, three types of jam and honey. You can make toast. Two types of scrambled eggs and fried eggs. Three types of hot meat: sausages, bacon and something else (we don't eat meat))). Just enough! Bathroom without a curtain, no problem. The problem in this city is to find showers with sides, but in Leipzig everything is wonderful with this! Fan worked. Shower set: caps, soap, gel, shampoo. We had a great time at this hotel! I leave a photo to improve external factors. And it will be great! Recommend

Disliked: The hotel has only 2 small parking spaces. Parking is possible in the small streets around the property, but only on weekends or at a paid parking garage about 300 metres from the property.

Liked: The price is bad. That's a lot of money for quality.
Breakfast was good, the coffee was delicious. the central place
Disliked: the bed too soft

Liked: The room was spacious. The bed was soft. The location was on the border of the old town and quite quiet.
Disliked: The room was very hot and there was no air conditioning, the breakfast was modest, the shower was right next to the toilet bowl and there were no screens or curtains, flooding the entire bathroom floor - very unpleasant.

Liked: Nothing noteworthy.
Disliked: Very small room with difficulty of movement and place to leave suitcase. Constant smell of dust probably due to carpet. WC NO BOX for bath. No matter how careful you take it, it intensively wets, including the toilet.

Liked: Good coffee selection
Disliked: The shower was in the bathroom toilet without separation
I booked a parking space, but then I had to leave it in the street.
The hotel needs a renovation!

Liked: The only good thing was the location, which is perfect, and the staff that tried at all times to help me.
Disliked: The room is very old and quite shabby. It was cold and I had to borrow a heater. In the ad they say there is a free parking, but that's a lie...the car stops on the street in front of the hotel, but the next day they force you to remove it at 8...I managed to negotiate with them but they allowed me until 1. I do not think it is normal to put free parking when it does not exist. Booking should also check this information and answer when I write to them.

Liked: Location
Disliked: We specifically asked for parking, they said it was fine, we made the reservation, but when we got there, they said, "No space, there's a pay parking lot," and we had to pay half the extra parking fee for the accommodation.

Liked: Nothing...
Disliked: The furnaces don't work...- The rooms are small and stuffy...

Liked: It is located in the city centre, close to the old town.
Disliked: The bathroom is small. The shower, sink and toilet bowl are all functionally located.

Liked: The location is right in the Kapana
Disliked: He's a little rusty.

Liked: No breakfast. Nice location.
The room was very clean, spacious. The hotel is in a quiet street and close to the centre. I recommend it!

Exceptional location. is located in the heart of Plovdiv - the Kapana Art District. All the pubs and main shopping street are 5-6 minutes from the hotel. They were also cooperating with us on the parking.
The location and friendliness of the staff.
Disliked: The air conditioning didn't work and I slept all night with the window open and the consequent noise. But it is true, that under this circumstance we were offered a room in the quieter area of the hotel.

Liked: The location is unbeatable. Although it is close to everything, it is in a quiet street to rest. The room is very spacious and clean, the beds very comfortable. Breakfast is a very clean, bright dining room with a very complete buffett. They gave us the room ahead of time.
Disliked: Everything was very good

Liked: The location
Disliked: The breakfast lacks variety.

Liked: The breakfast was good and the bed comfortable.
Disliked: The bathroom was very small and the shower was not separated by a curtain or something like that! When you showered, all inclusive of the toilet was wet!

Liked: Quiet and clean

Disliked: Although it says that the hotel has a parking space and no reservation is needed for a parking space, there are actually only 4 spaces available. There is no actual parking and the hotel is located in a green area where parking is not allowed.

Liked: Location
Disliked: Everything was fine.

Liked: Great location, rooms are themed, staff are great.
Disliked: There are no parking spaces.

Liked: The location
Disliked: Shower

Liked: BREAKFAST REGULAR LOCATION GOOD
Disliked: CONTRACTING PARKING, THEN AS a RESULT THEY DID NOT HAVE, OR THE ONE THEY HAD WAS ARRIVED, WAS A PROBLEM SINCE THE TWO MATTRESSES HAD TO BE LOOKING FOR MOVE THE AUTO.

Liked: I'm always happy to stay at the Daffy Hotel. The staff is very friendly. I like the location of the hotel.
Disliked: I would recommend a more varied breakfast.

Liked: Nice, big, clean room. Pleasant stuff. Pet friendly. Near city center..
The hotel is close to the center and very clean. The room was big and comfortable. The staff was very kind and welcoming. The breakfast was ok. It was a nice stay..
Reliable staff and room was better than photos. .They provided a cot for my toddler..Heating in the room was set upon check in..Overall comfortable stay..
Location and rooms were good..
Disliked: Everything was fine except the genius free breakfast, we only got a banana and tiny piece of dry loaf. We sat there for half an hour expecting them to bring something else but never did so it was a waste of time. They should just not say they provide free breakfast and we could have saved ourselves the time and go eat somewhere else which we ended up doing anyway..

Liked: Near to downtown. Spacious room..
Central location. Good staff. Clean rooms..
Disliked: I didn't like that we didn't have parking lot because was full but they was ready to offer their safe place in front of hotel..It should be better breakfast included just coffee and cake..

Liked: Clean and well decorated place. Rooms are a good size and well equipped..
Disliked: They have parking spots but with only 6 spots for over 20 rooms parking was never available..

Liked: The staff is friendly and helpful. The room is spacious. Location  is very close to the center. Breakfast is very good..
Disliked: Parking place is not optimal - people should go out of the car before (the doors can not be opened after the car is in the parking cage). There is no contact with the staff in the veneing, so if there is a problem, there is noone available to help..

Liked: The rooms were very clean and comfortable the breakfast was really good and the staff were brilliant.
Disliked: The one thing was that the pool was not heated and the spa services were out sourced which meant they had to be prebooked  well in advance. However this was probably due to the covid problems..

Liked: The staff were brilliant breakfast was very good and the room very clean..
Disliked: As the hotel had been closed all summer the little splash pool,was not heated so unusable and any use of the spa had to be booked well in advance as they were not on site..

Liked: Good breakfast, very helpful and kind staff, good location. A perfect venue to spend a city-break..
Very clean apartment and polite stuff. The towels were changed every day and the apartment was cleaned regularly..
Disliked: Terrible breakfast..

Liked: Friendly, helpful staff..Great location..
A short walk from the old town. A good restaurant in the park opposite the hotel. Breakfast was fine, sometimes cooked, sometimes a buffet. Rooms clean and large. Staff friendly. Good value..
Disliked: The area was a little outside the old town but only a short 10 minute walk. The old town and other areas have lots of bars and restaurants. Unfortunately no bars or places to eat around the hotel area, except for a good restaurant opposite the hotel in the park. ..

Liked: It was just like any other business hotels. Clean and decent bedroom. It was well located near the center..
Disliked: We didn't like the parking facility though..

Liked: Location.

It's just outside of the old town in a sort of "dead" area as far as markets, restaurants, etc., are concerned.  Easy enough to walk into the old town, though, and to the singing fountains.   It's about a 15 minute straight line walk or more to the bus stop..
Disliked: Not the fault of the hotel, of course, but the nearest "market" indicated by the desk clerk turned out to be a kiosk with cold beverage machines, some newspapers, and some packaged food.  I bought a beer and a choco-roll, which was actually quite delicious.  :-)    I'd probably walk a few more minutes or take a taxi for a place closer to or even within old town next time..

Liked: The apartment was ideal for 3 off us staying and the staff were very helpful and happy and we had a good sleep. The restaurant is very Good with large variety of food for all..
Disliked: It would be good to add milk (UHT) with coffee in the rooms..

Liked: perfect location.
Disliked: there is no parking , small rooms.

Liked: Great location opposite the park with a nice view from our room. Very helpful staff. Good air con..
Disliked: No milk in the room for coffee.

Liked: We chose Noviz Hotel for the event of Open Opera 2019..The hotel is located 15 min walking from Old Town and Ancient Theatre, so no need to use your car, especially in Plovdiv (is well known as Mission Impossible to find a parking place)..The hotel is not very big, but the rooms are large and clean; the bath room as well..There is a elevator to the 5th floor, a small restaurant for breakfast, and a SPA center in the cellar..The main reason (for me) to book rooms at Noviz was to have a parking place !.ADIVICE: when you are making your reservation, BOOK for a parking place as well, as the places are not too many !.
A good place to stay.
Nice bed.
Disliked: Evening facilities. No coffee choice. Poor bar..

Liked: The suite apartment was very comfortable for 3 persons, closed to old town ( 8-10' by foot), clean and quiet. The breakfast was ok but not rich. We asked if could leave our car after the check out in the parking for extra hours and they said yes right away. We would stay again in Noviz in the future..
Disliked: Nothing.

Liked: Staff at the reception desk was very friendly and agreed to hold our luggage for a few hours after checking out while we explored the city..
Disliked: We were charged for a water bottle from the minibar which we didn't consume. The housekeeping staff claimed it was missing and implied we were lying. We hadn't even noticed where the minibar was..

Liked: Friendly staff with great English, clean, good balcony although small..10 min walk to Plovdiv old town..Printed out boarding pass for me (free).
Disliked: Had to pay one euro for water with my dinner meal (stayed half board) water was free with breakfast.
.Disliked ¬†¬∑¬†For some reason i have booked both rooms for 583 euro, but i was charged 604euro on my card when i payed the day i was leaving. And it was just for the stay the price.

Liked: Nice place, not very far from city centre. Breakfast was very good, with great variety for every taste. Comfortable room, good bed..
Disliked: Bathroom only offers a tub, not very convenient..

Liked: Great location!.
Top location. The hotel is near all top downtown locations and you can visit almost everything after a short walk..
Disliked: Most of the rooms are facing the main boulevard which is very crowded during the day..

Liked: Great location. For family with kids, a big park is just across the road..
Disliked: Furnishing needs upgrade.

Liked: Great breakfast ‚Ä¶. this was very good.
Disliked: Neat place, but some staff needed better training. I mean better customer service ‚Ä¶..

Liked: The hotel is slightly away from the city centre however it's only a short walk. The rooms are very spacious. Free street parking available nearby..
Disliked: Slightly aged decor and facilities..

Liked: - Good breakfast.- Efficient service.- Good location to the city centre.
Everything was good, room, bed, stuff. One of better accomodations in Bulgaria.
Disliked: There could be more to offer for a dinner.

Liked: Everything OK for the money. Parking could be an issue..

The bath sink was partially blocked. The curtains have not been washed or cleaned for a while. I tried opening a window and it was full of spider webs and other small insects - definitely not been cleaned recently. .The bed sheets were old too and felt like hospital ones. The pillow was rock solid and hard. The air-con is at least 10-15 years old, so it's extremely noisy..I'd expect the rooms in this property to cost no more than 40-50 leva a night based on all the issues described above, but I get how pricing and demand works, so they can get away with it for now. .If you got nowhere else to stay and need a roof, hot water and a flat surface to lay on like we did - go for it, otherwise look elsewhere.

Liked: Three of us stayed at the hotel (me, wife and daughter). We booked a room with one large bed. And the room and the location of the hotel and the view from the room were very pleased. In addition to the bed (which was actually made up of two single beds), there were two more small couches in the room. The hotel is located in the city center next to the Hill "Bunardzhika", where there are playgrounds, a sports ground, a fountain. At the top is a monument to Russian soldiers "Alyosha". Our room had a view of the park. The hotel has a fairly simple, but good and hearty breakfast. The room has a safe, air conditioning, TV with Russian channels, full bathroom, balcony.

We came by car, you can park on the neighboring streets or for extra. fee in the courtyard of the hotel. Very close to a huge shopping center Mall with an exchange office (euro 1.95 leva), a large supermarket on the 2nd floor, a food court and a cinema. Opposite the park and ... The very monument to the Soviet soldier Alyosha, which is sung in the famous song <<Does the powder turn white in the field>> Take a room with breakfast included, you will not regret it. We stayed in a two bedroom apartment as we were with two children. Very spacious and comfortable. There is a kettle, tea and coffee. Internet caught very well.

Excellent location, very attentive staff, spacious and comfortable room in every way, clean.
Breakfast: good selection for a small hotel reception extremely helpful and attentive

Disliked: Very old and noisy air conditioning. - 8:00. The reception is closed all night. There's no one on duty. If you don't have an explicit parking reservation, you're gonna have to park in the adjacent streets.
