Liked: Near downtown.
Disliked: hard bedding, restaurant closed when it should have been open..I came by bike and unfortunately was damaged in the room.

Liked: A great hotel with excellent service, the staff are very kind and helpful. Its location is beautiful, next to a large park and 7 minutes away. from the center! I'll definitely visit again!
The hotel is located near the city center.
Disliked: The decoration of the rooms and the breakfast room is redone completely.

Liked: Staff very polite
I'm glad I didn't spend the night out.
Very friendly and helpful! Secure car parking space in the garage. We will be back if we travel to Plovdiv again!
The location is fine, although the hotel is located on the boulevard...
Disliked: - Parking is small, therefore charges apply and there are no other convenient parking spaces nearby..- Breakfast is not like the pictures... 5-6 options are available, but the rations are scarce..I wanted coffee at 12:20 on Sundays and the restaurant was closed, although it was announced that it was open until 1:00..- The reception staff was not particularly helpful with directions..- The price is too high for the old rooms and towels, etc. There is a spa, but it is available at an additional cost...

Liked: Convenient location, friendly staff, great apartment! You had everything you needed and the best part is that I got accepted with my puppy.
The only good thing about the hotel is the swimming/something.
Disliked: The room was awful, the air conditioning was turned off central, it was terribly cold, there was only one lousy sheet to cover.The bed was in a creak and creaking.The staff was awful greasy.

Liked: Great location, in the city centre..At first, I was put in a room without a terrace, but after I asked for a room with a terrace, they immediately granted my wish..My room was extremely clean, facing the backyard, where it was incredibly quiet. .Breakfast is on the level, there's everything to eat..There is also a car park (a little hard to get into, but the front desk assisted me with the parking - I'm a woman..The staff is smiling and friendly.
Disliked: I like everything.

Liked: The breakfast is edible but poor. Served on washed tablecloths and crumpled napkins.
Disliked: Poor interiors and restaurant and rooms. The sockets didn't work. The refrigerator didn't work. Wifi barely breathed.

Liked: Excellent hotel manager, attentive and decisive, they speak English.
Disliked: Nothing to point out

The park is too narrow. Breakfast is not good. They charge the dog. They won't let him in the breakfast room. No bellboy. Location is near old city. It's hard to stay. We drank a bottle of water from the room. 2 leva. Free in every hotel.

Liked: Nothing. Nothing.
Disliked: The hotel does not match the 4-star rating!

Liked: The room was nice.
Disliked: The kitchen area costs a lot and they charge a drink.

Liked: I liked the LARGE of the room, the terrace-balcony to be able to smoke and the large and comfortable bed.
Disliked: The location is not very far from the center but at night and in summer it is too dark (in winter also the return to the HOTEL will be very cold) and the cobblestone streets, so you have to be very careful. We put the flashlight on our cell phone in some areas..We didn't like the bathtub too high to get out of it safely. I almost fell the first time and I'm not short.  I asked to change rooms but was told that it was not possible (hotel was not full)–µAlso the bathroom sink was always clogged... We used the bathtub to wash our teeth, face, hands..The reception staff changed every day and the few questions we asked, they answered us just enough..So much so that when we asked about THE AUTO TERMINAL, they told us where the terminal near the HOTEL was, but it turns out that in PLOVDIV, there are 2 bus terminals. And the best time slot I had and more travel options to Burgas was the other.  .The first day of breakfast, we almost died of heat, because someone forgot to put the AIR CONDITIONED and when we left, a lady came and put it, but there was no one left in the breakfast room. In short... details.

Liked: We all really enjoyed it! Nice, cozy, quiet room, comfortable beds, balcony overlooking the garden. Good tasty breakfast in the morning! On site parking. Nice staff! A beautiful hotel! The city center and main attractions are within walking distance. Near a good shopping center. Thanks for a good vacation!

On the second day of my stay, I went back to the hotel and found my room cleaned and air-conditioned. It was very impressive, because the time I was there was very hot. All are at the reception level, staff, bar. Very kind and kind.
Disliked: I have no objections.

Liked: Central location!
Disliked: Old, unsanitary and unventilated bathrooms! Poor, maximum 2 stars!

Disliked: Bathroom cleaning

Disliked: It is ugly, uncomfortable, old, without any taste. It looks like a guesthouse. They are 2 stars behind. .Scarce and bad breakfast, with rubber tablecloths.

The staff does not speak any language other than Bulgarian. The hotel is old and by European standards pulls 2 stars but not 4. This is a parody. There is a sauna in the basement, which makes the whole hotel stink of steam and sewage. Breakfast in a god-killed canteen called a restaurant. Bath after 20 years of use. Liked: The check-in process was fast and efficient - it is worth mentioning the welcoming attitude of the front desk - very good job! The room was clean, bright and with comfortable beds. It features a digital TV as well with most of the popular Bulgarian channels. The location is superb and I find it almost equally distant from the city centre and the main bus and train stations. By walk, it will take you around 15 minutes to reach both places. The price was absolutely spot on and it is a great value for your money - even though I stayed during the pandemic times, where the prices were low in general, but if they manage to keep it as it is, I would have no doubts, but to recommend this place. I had a really pleasant and seamless stay. The only thing, I am sorry about, is that I didn't tried their restaurant, I am curious to see if they match the overall quality service with their food offerings - maybe next time :).

Overall, this property is the best I could find in terms of value for money/excellent location/parking. Only a few minutes away from the city centre and main street, safe neighbourhood, easily accessible! .Despite it being only a 2*, the hotel is great. Receptionists are friendly and always happy to answer questions and help, the room is clean and spacious enough, the view from it looks to the main boulevard in front of the property. Breakfast is good and on a buffer. One of the days I was offered a choice from menu and the English breakfast is amazing! .Internet's speed is quite good and available throughout. Lobby area is suitable for an online meeting or a few hours of quiet work time. .Loved that there is a Nescafe Dolce Gusto coffee machine available at reception with couple of flavours to choose from..
Disliked: I had couple of questions before my stay and although the property replied quickly in the beginning, later on, I didn't hear back from them (that is via email) until I actually got there. .As a con, I have to mention the parking area. It's great there is one, it's shared with the nearby offices. However, the spaces are quite narrow so good parking skills required. .Only a few TV channels available..I stayed for 4 nights and no one cleaned the room during that time. Once every 2 days would have been nice. .However, this will not change my mind to stay at this hotel again in the future..

Liked: Their staff is super, caring and helpful..The transportation is very comfortable, quite clean and affordable..They change their dining options according to their guests' beliefs..It is definitely one of the places to stay..

Liked: It is an excellent, brand new hotel, nicely furnished in a business style. Very comfortable beds. Extremely clean. Right next to the main building of Plovdiv University. A nice night town view from our room (6th floor)..
Disliked: There is no proper sign for the parking entrance. We've made 3 circles in the quarter before to find it, actually after calling the reception desk for help. Since the car is not allowed to stop in front of the hotel,  the management should definitely work to improve the access to the hotel by big sign/label. Otherwise, the parking lot is OK, but again a labbel for the first time visitors is needed..

Parking is on the street..It's a cul-de-sac. Access throughout the old town is also only via a controlled badge that is handed by the owner. So meeting is at the barrier and not directly at home..I really appreciated the coffee offered as Dolce Gusto capsules and especially the drawing made by the owner of the place who is a very good artist.
Disliked: One of the rooms and the kitchen overlooks the big boulevard. It is therefore necessary to put the people least sensitive to noise on this side. But the windows are double glazed and that is enough.

Liked: Stayed at this property in July (triple room cost for one night 7047 LEV, with payment at the property, free cancellation until 3pm on the day of arrival, no breakfast). Quite large and comfortable room with comfortable bed and pillows. Bright enough with good artificial lighting. There is an LCD TV, a clothes hanger and a window. Good room cleaning. Good room temperature. The general soundproofing is not the best as it is located on a boulevard as well as not having walls thick enough and you can easily hear the noises coming from the corridor and from the other rooms. Modern and functional furniture. The bathroom is a good size and has a shower. Towels and toiletries available. Good WiFi. It is located at the entrance to the city and is very convenient for visiting. The hotel has a free but limited private parking in front of it. Not all staff speak English but are helpful and friendly. No breakfast provided. The property is street motel for one or two nights and away without being too pretentious. I believe the price paid and the services offered all in all in line with my expectations. Recommended for short stays if you are passing through. My overall rating is 7/10. I would stay here again.

Liked: Stayed at this property (single use room cost for one night 20 euros, payment on arrival, free cancellation, no breakfast). Room quite large, however it does not stand out for comfort with bed and pillows not the best. There is an LCD TV, a clothes hanger and a French window with access to a small terrace. Room cleaning good but not the best. The temperature of the room is also good (there is air conditioning). The general soundproofing is not the best as you can easily hear the noises coming from the corridor, from the other rooms and from the outside. Spartan but functional furniture. The bathroom is minimal and has a bathtub (which is not very convenient for entry / exit). Towels and toiletries present but minimal. Free WiFi available throughout. It is located on a busy street, outside the town but not far (you can easily reach it in 10/15 minutes on foot). You need a car to get to the property. The hotel has free on street parking (limited for the luckiest), otherwise you have to navigate the inner streets. Staff at check in spoke English and seemed quite helpful and friendly. No breakfast provided. The property is a one night street motel without infamy and without praise. I believe the price paid and the services offered in line with my expectations. I recommend staying for a night or two to visit the city or if you are passing by. My overall vote is 7/10 and I would stay there again.

Disliked: There is no elevator to the upper floors. We didn‚Äôt take breakfast, it seemed to us that 15 leva for breakfast per person (and there were 3 of us) was a little expensive.

Liked: Ok

Excellent location in the historical center of Plovdiv. The atmosphere of the hotel and the owner are fully consistent with the location of the hotel. European level hotel. Hope to return again. Thanks Boris.
A hotel decorated in the style of yesteryear, like a small museum ....
Dinner at the restaurant was good. Housewives are loved.
Disliked: The room was a little cold.

Liked: Nice room.  Close to downtown.
Disliked: No window in the room. .Limited breakfast and limited menu in the restaurant.

Liked: cleanliness, courteous staff, wonderful setting, spectacular views
Disliked: There is no such thing.

Liked: Wonderful location, overlooking all of Plovdiv.
Disliked: Attic room only accessible by stairs. Toilet Location very inconvenient.

Liked: The hotel's location is good in the old town, close to the trap.
Disliked: I didn't like the way the staff treated me, probably the hotel owners. For not having the bathroom ventilation working and notifying the woman who put us in, asking to be removed, I tolerated the arrogant behavior of the man who met me at the coffee table, knowing that the signal was being sent from our room. .As for the facilities, our room had no terrace, the TV was mounted on the wall next to the bedroom. .The hotel locks in the evening and we have to ring the bell to get us home.

Liked: Liked everything. Very beautiful city. Awesome hotel !!! The owner - Boris is just a miracle! The hotel is sophisticated yet inexpensive. For two nights 100 euros. Accommodation, location, service 10 out of 10. The last photo of the owner is Boris Hristov.
A beautiful place, made with measure and taste! Great hosts!
Very warm welcome, the boss and his wife are very caring..Very nice quiet place in the old quarter.

Excellent location in the old town. Public parking next to the hotel. After paying at the hotel, we left the car for another half a day. We were very warmly received and seated quickly. The hotel is not new but in perfect condition. Very clean. Good breakfast. There is no elevator to the upper floors, but for us it did not matter)

Wonderful hotel. Located in the center of the old town, everything is within walking distance. Beautiful rooms, one room was with a panoramic view of the city, there are balconies. We arrived by car at lunchtime, we were met by the owner of the hotel Boris very cordially and kindly. We dined with him in the restaurant, I liked everything very much, table setting, serving dishes, it was delicious (special thanks to the chef). Parking on the street, near the hotel is free. I recommend the hotel to stay.

The restaurant was closed, that is. there was no breakfast. Room size did not match the stated room size. The staff is grumpy. The front door is locked and guests are not provided with a key. The layout is great. A hotel for one night, but not for long stays.
- Oh, great.

Disliked: The hotel owner's attitude has shocked me. Our breakfast was served in the restaurant. There was a terrace where the tables were loaded. We moved there, in the fresh air and the cool. The owner came in angry, rude, insulted us, and then, half an hour later, he came back to apologize. Purely Bulgarian...

Liked: Friendly welcome. -Comfortable room - Very good restaurant on site with the city and good advice from the boss!.In the heart of the old town so ideal for walking and discovering everything on foot - Possibility of parking in the perpendicular street for free (you must show the resa to the guards at the entrance)

A friendly welcome, a conquering setting, clean, quiet and cosy. There's a lot of work involved in every single detail of the interior and it's rightly called Buticov! A delicious and varied breakfast with beautiful music. Excellent location and parking space provided.
The location
Disliked: Room was in the basement, without windows!!! You don't know if it's day or night. Hotel has no parking - we would have to park our car far away. At breakfast you only get a small cup of coffee, every other cup - 5 Lw!!!!

Liked: The hotel in the old town, but difficult to access!
Disliked: The standard room is in the basement, no window and too expensive! The boss not very friendly with the customer who does not speak English!

Liked: Location
Disliked: Bad welcome Friendly staff! Room without a window in the basement floor! Incorrect in relationships with your company I was not warned about an invalid card on time, but after leaving the hotel at 13:30

Liked: Boris support
It is a 2 star hotel that wants to sell it as a 4 star. I mean it's a scam for the price they charge, their only advantage is the location.

Disliked: Our mistake: we did not read the room description. We had a room without windows like in a dungeon. We then paid for a better one. Why is there a 4 star hotel like this on booking.com??Breakfast very moderate   we are disappointed.

Liked: Breakfast is served, nothing was missing. The hotel is located in the center of the old town Plovdiv, the environment is absolutely quiet. All the sights are in close proximity
The location is perfect, the kind of owner

Disliked: It is a two star hotel with the price of a four star.
The owner of the hotel was very unfriendly and not helpful with anything.

DISAPPOINTING IH EVERYBODY REALLY CHEERS-UP- The hotel has nine rooms, four of which are underground (in the basement). No windows, no air, and you can smell the moisture immediately when you enter. Especially in the summer, it's disgusting. And that's not enough, and they even call these rooms VIP, like that's gonna make people feel less screwed up. Don't book rooms 101 to 104!) or as they call them VIP 1 to VIP 4..The hotel has a nine rooms, four of them are underground. There is no windows, there is no air, you can smell the moisture. It is disgusting. They call this rooms VIP, this is the biggest joke.  DO NOT RESERVE rooms from 101 to 104, ohhhh sorry VIP1 to VIP4

Liked: Location in the old town
Disliked: Booked room was WITHOUT window (blind), which was not in the description. The artificial ventilation did not work properly (heated instead of cooling and air to bring).The bed linen (pumpamuster in yellow and brown) was made of synthetic fiber (polyester) the bath mat as well - a real hygiene problem, especially since both towels and bed linen had been treated with tons of textile veredlers, which is very problematic for an allergy-sufferer like me..The "host" saw in the guest basically an enemy, if he was not satisfied with the offered service, without however suggesting a solution. On my own request, after a sleepless night for an extra charge of 54 Leva I got a room with a window and air conditioning. The host himself has not suggested a solution. The mattress was just as "underground" as in the original room. On the sleepless night I found out that this "host" is already known for this action by Tripadvisor like a colorful dog. Too bad I did not check in beforehand.

Liked: The only hospitable, nice person in the hotel seems to be Boris, unfortunately, he was only on the last day before finally a friendly word, not as dismissive as I have felt the other staff members..The expensive room 201 has a wonderful view, is generously equipped..For the individual breakfast, no buffet, there is Lavazza coffee! In addition, fresh eggs and a selection of cheese and sausage..From the hotel in the wonderful old town it is just 300 meters down to Kapana, for evening I recommend the restaurant Photo Club, a bit below the hotel.
Disliked: I thought we were received warmly, instead I felt uninvited. A young woman showed me the booked room in the basement WITHOUT windows (only narrow tilting windows without a view), so I was disappointed. She again said that was in the description and the guests would not read it......well, it says that the room had artificial lighting, the fine print is not interpreted as a basement at least straight away. .After I chose another room, the price changed...the owner's wife was on the phone with him, giving her daughter prices, which she again told me, with the result that it was more and more expensive. .So: with this knowledge I would never book here, I felt unwelcoming and ripped off, not hospitable at all!!.There are 30 Bulgarian programs on the TV, but not a single international one!

Liked: The location in the old town and the cute
Disliked: The difficulty to access the hotel by car.In fact I think it was not accessible and we could not communicate clearly enough with the hotel owners (family hotel).

Liked: The location of the hotel is very good but uncomfortable for a car. Breakfast was delicious and varied. The staff was friendly, but we have some comments about the facilities.
Disliked: There's no parking, which wasn't clear in advance, and the car is sitting in one of the curved streets nearby. We had to move in without our luggage, only with toiletries, because climbing suitcases down narrow and winding stairs made it impossible. Because of the chimney and the nailed windows, it was very hot on the fourth floor, and we asked the owner to turn on the air conditioning. He did it a little reluctant and a little complicated, and in the middle of the night, we found out that he cut the power, probably for savings. The refrigerator was something that was homemade on the VW brand that made too much noise. Overall, the experience was definitely unpleasant and we couldn't wait until morning to leave. We would certainly not repeat the accommodation in Boris Palace, however picturesque and meticulously furnished in the spirit of ancient Plovdiv.

Liked: Unique location. Good base. Excellent cuisine.
Disliked: Unpleasant, irritating, and even rude to the owner.

Funny as it sounds, the beds and the drapes were even so soft and comfortable. This apartment is a real comfort, not to mention the facilities. If you want to cook, you can find anything you might need to cook, even spices. The apartment is very convenient for shopping, there are both 24-hour shops and a large shop on the corner. The apartment is a 10-minute walk from the centre of Plovdiv, which is a great advantage. There's a hairdryer if you want to take a bath. This is the second time I've come here, and I'd certainly like to visit again, because it always exceeds my expectations. The landlord is smiling, friendly and friendly. Everything was perfect. I have no complaints.‚Äù.

.‚ÄúThis apartment was far better than I had expected and is furnished and decorated to a high standard;  the location is very convenient, with free street parking nearby (I was fortunate enough to park directly outside, however it should be possible to find parking within two streets' distance), yet only 10-20 minutes' walk from the old town (depending on which part).  It's also very spacious and clean, with just about everything one is likely to need for a comfortable stay and only five minutes' walk from the local Lidl,  The host was especially accommodating, friendly and helpful (and speaks perfect English, which is very rare in Bulgaria),‚Äù.

.‚ÄúThe flat, in a Plovdiv/Bulgarian state-of-the-arts block of flats (no irony intended), on the top floor accessible by reliable lift, was comfortable and very good value. The city centre is very easy to reach by foot, local shops are to be found not far round the corner, two large supermarkets within 5-10 minutes' walk, main railway station and coach station five minutes by taxi.‚Äù.

.‚ÄúThis apartment was far better than I had expected and is furnished and decorated to a high standard;  the location is very convenient, with free street parking nearby (I was fortunate enough to park directly outside, however it should be possible to find parking within two streets' distance), yet only 10-20 minutes' walk from the old town (depending on which part). .‚ÄúThe flat, in a Plovdiv/Bulgarian state-of-the-arts block of flats (no irony intended), on the top floor accessible by reliable lift, was comfortable and very good value. Liked: The receptionist which checked me in was exceptionally friendly and helpful, the best I met anywhere in Bulgaria (unfortunately I don't know her name)..The room was nice and clean, the bed was good (rather soft than hard, for those which are interested in this aspect)..A complimentary bottle of water and a candy on the pillow were a nice surprise when I arrived..The internet connection worked fine and at good speed..
Disliked: I left my room at 1 pm and when I returned at 10 pm the garbage was not picked and the towel I left on the bathroom floor - not changed. Maybe the cleaning ladies work just half-time ? Thanks to the boy on the night shift at the reception, which was very friendly and brought me a clean towel..At the first breakfast, I asked for an additional slice of bread after the serving time was over. The waitress was visibly unhappy and "reported me" in Bulgarian to the girl at the reception, which in turn transmitted to me (in English) I will receive the bread, however it would be better to show up for breakfast earlier, because the serving time is over ! At check-out I mentioned this incident and both the receptionist (a different one) and especially the lady in charge of the lobby bar apologised and were very friendly, managing to reduce my bad impression. However, I still ask myself how the first receptionist was able to blame me for a slice of bread, instead of settling the situation with the waitress in Bulgarian (I don't understand the language, so I would have never known what was "the big problem" of the waitress)..Insect nets at the windows would be useful, when I aired the room some night butterflies managed to get inside, despite the curtain being in place. .The hotel was further than I expected from the railway station and city center, not quite at walking distance (especially when with luggage), so I chose to take a taxi to and from the station. This is of course not a negative remark to the hotel, just an information for other tourists..
